extraction_prompt.system_role: You are a Korean linguist and database engineer specializing in webtoon vocabulary extraction for spaced-repetition learning systems.

objective.goal: Extract ALL vocabulary items and grammar patterns necessary for FULL comprehension of the dialogue above.
objective.end_state: Enable a learner to read this chapter without encountering unknown vocabulary or grammar.

principles.principle: Do NOT exclude items because they are basic, frequent, or typically taught early
Assume the learning platform tracks whether a user already knows an item

extraction_prompt.instructions: Based on the dialogue above, extract vocabulary entries and return valid JSON matching the schema below.

chapter_example.description: Extract the EXACT sentence or phrase from the dialogue where this item appears.

constraints.constraint: Must be verbatim from the dialogue text
Must preserve original conjugation and surface form

chapter_example.example: If the dialogue contains "헌터협회 소속 중에서", use that exact phrase.

global_example.description: Create a SIMPLE, GENERIC example sentence demonstrating basic usage.

constraints.constraint: Must NOT reference this chapter’s plot, characters, or setting
Must represent the item’s core meaning across contexts

chapter_example_preservation.rule: Preserve the ORIGINAL conjugated or inflected form exactly as it appears in the dialogue.

grammar_normalization.rule: Normalize grammar patterns to their canonical template form

honorific_handling.rule: Strip honorific marker (시) from the dictionary form unless the term is inherently honorific.

include.item: Fixed multi-word lexical units (포기하다, 한몫 잡다)
Grammar patterns functioning as semantic units (-기 때문에, -ㄹ 수 있다, -지 않게)
Discourse markers and connectors (하긴, 그러니, 그래도)

exclude.item: Pure particles or case markers (이/가, 은/는, 을/를, 에, 에서, 도, 만)
Isolated function morphemes with no standalone study value
Pure onomatopoeia with no semantic content (와, 헉)

sense_key_rules.criticality: senseKey is a database constraint and must remain STABLE across chapters.

romanization.rule: Follow Revised Romanization (RR) standards. Romanization must be lowercase.

vowel_mapping.basic: ㅏ:a, ㅐ:ae, ㅑ:ya, ㅒ:yae, ㅓ:eo, ㅔ:e, ㅕ:yeo, ㅖ:ye, ㅗ:o, ㅛ:yo, ㅜ:u, ㅠ:yu, ㅡ:eu, ㅣ:i
vowel_mapping.compound: ㅘ:wa, ㅙ:wae, ㅚ:oe, ㅝ:wo, ㅞ:we, ㅟ:wi, ㅢ:ui

consonant_mapping.initial: ㄱ:g, ㄴ:n, ㄷ:d, ㄹ:r, ㅁ:m, ㅂ:b, ㅅ:s, ㅇ:null, ㅈ:j, ㅊ:ch, ㅋ:k, ㅌ:t, ㅍ:p, ㅎ:h
consonant_mapping.final: ㄱ:k, ㄴ:n, ㄷ:t, ㄹ:l, ㅁ:m, ㅂ:p, ㅅ:t, ㅇ:ng, ㅈ:t, ㅊ:t, ㅋ:k, ㅌ:t, ㅍ:p, ㅎ:t

homonym_resolution.rule: Determine meaning strictly from dialogue context

canonical_synonyms.rule: Always choose the most common English concept

multiword_concepts.rule: Use underscores for multi-word romanization and meaning

exclude_only.item: Character names and proper nouns unless lexicalized (선생님)
Pure sound effects with no lexical meaning

include.item: Basic verbs, adjectives, and adverbs (하다, 있다, 가다, 잘, 더)
Discourse-level words affecting tone or flow

importance_scoring.definition: importanceScore reflects how NECESSARY the item is for understanding this chapter.
importance_scoring.constraint: Do NOT score based on difficulty, rarity, or learner level.
importance_scoring.note: distribute rankings uniformly within their respective ranges

validation_checklist.check: Every Korean term is in dictionary or canonical template form
Same Korean word + same meaning → same senseKey across chapters
Each entry has TWO distinct examples
